Description:
Endearing Victorian in an Enviable Location
Transformed by a comprehensive restoration, this captivating brick Victorian residence with off street parking retains authentic period character whilst delivering cutting edge design, supreme privacy and an abundance of natural light. Striking the ultimate balance between style and functionality, the interiors are arranged to maximize natural light and seamlessly integrate the indoors and the outdoors. Impeccably retained historical features such as ornate cornices, ceiling roses, attic storage and decorative fireplaces are enhanced by the addition of comprehensively appointed modern comforts such as ducted heating, plantation shutters and a European laundry. Ideally positioned moments from Fawkner Park, trams, buses and an array of shops and dining options on Toorak Road with South Yarra Station, various schools, the Botanic Gardens and Chapel Street an easy walk.

This extremely rare double front (circa)1860s Victoria residence has been Artfully composed by renowned Architect, Matt Gibson, bringing the past and the future into the present, in one of South Yarras most prestigious locations.
